page.title: 20SUMMARY
page.content: In general it seems that life in Bingham is more than acceptable. There exists a good, thriving and happy community, which will accept any change for the better but is aware of the problems of modern society and keeps a vigilant eye on potential and existing problems which may affect the inhabitants. There has been little mention of older people but there are excellent facilities and residences available to them and they are well cared for. It only remains to thank the children from all four shools for their ideas and the information they collected, the teachers who assimilated and edited the information (K.J.Robinson,P.Renshaw,H.Sylvester and C.Conway) without whom these pages would not have been possible.
